title: Jenny Ryan back for X Factor: Celebrity live shows in massive U-turn from judges
text:
Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

The Chase's Vixen, the quiz master Jenny Ryan, won't be heading home from the X Factor after all.

After being booted from the celebrity edition of the show on Saturday night, Jenny was told by judges Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh and Nicole Scherzinger that she wouldn't be taking to the live stage.

Having thought about their decision though, the judges opted to give Jenny a spot on the live shows after she blew away fans with her rendition of Queen's Somebody to Love.

Jenny gushed about the decision: "I've loved every moment of the X Factor and I'm delighted to be able to get the opportunity to perform live.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

"The response from the public has been amazing - what an incredible experience. I'm so pleased it's continuing!"

Jenny's mentor, former Pussycat Doll Nicole, said: "Jenny was just brilliant at her audition in LA. That voice of hers is one of a kind, and she's an amazing person to get to know.

"So it was such a tough decision to make. After a lot of discussion we all agreed we had to put her through.

"The Overs are gonna smash it this year!"

Nicole's in charge of the Over 28s, and counts footballing legend Vinnie Jones among her mentees.

His future in the show was in question, after his wife Tanya sadly passed away before filming.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

However, in a phone call with head honcho Simon, Vinnie said that he would love to take part as it's what Tanya would've wanted him to do.

Jenny and Vinnie will both be up against some stiff competition, especially in the form of former Towie star Megan McKenna.

She already impressed judges with her country music chops, and some fans reckon she's headed to the finals.

Others stars include Love Actually's Olivia Olson, and a collection of Love Island stars from the class of 2018 - Wes Nelson , Samira Mighty , Zara McDermott and Eyal Booker.

Simon will be mentoring the groups, whereas the Under 28s are in Louis' hands.

The X Factor: Celebrity returns to ITV LIVE at 8:20pm on Saturday.
description: The Chase's Vixen will make a triumphant return for the live shows as Simon, Louis and Nicole elected to keep her in
